medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented with chest pain that started three hours prior to admission. Symptoms initially led to an assessment for hypertensive emergency, with blood pressure recorded at 220/100 mmHg. The chest pain and troponin elevation resolved after blood pressure normalization with nitroglycerin infusion over 24 hours.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a history of delayed developmental milestones, seizures, bilateral lens dislocations ('ectopia lentis'), a left hip fracture, and total hip replacement. She also experienced several thrombotic events, including bilateral lower extremities DVT four years prior to presentation.
medical_history.family_history: Family history includes the sudden death of her father at the age of 48, who had no known medical history.
